item.title: Dijkstra’s Shortest Path Algorithm: Intuition for proof and code in Python
item.description: What is shortest path? If you are already familiar with what Dijkstra’s shortest path algorithm intends to do then skip this section. A graph, for those who are unfamiliar or have forgotten, is just a collection of ordered pairs of “points” which are also called edges. These pairs of points may have a distance associated with them in which case they are known as “weighted”. Given a graph with positive weights and a source “vertex” i.
